thread.title: This champagne vending machine is what we all need in our office break room
thread.title_full: This champagne vending machine is what we all need in our office break room

author: Daryl Lindsey
title: This champagne vending machine is what we all need in our office break room
text:
This champagne vending machine is what we all need in our office break room You can now get bubbly at the push of a button, courtesy of a high-tech vending machine that sells champagne instead of candy and junk food.
The vending machine, located in the Sky Bar at Las Vegas’ Mandarin Oriental Hotel , sells mini bottles of Moët & Chandon (as well as tiny champagne flutes!). It is the first public champagne vending machine in the United States . 
To help comply with American liquor laws, customers must purchase a vending machine coin from the hotel’s front desk in order to use the machine. The coin costs $20, and customers must present their ID to prove they’re over 21.
I found it!!! Now how do I get one for my house? #molasvegas #moetmoment 
A post shared by Maja Ulakovic (@missmajaulakovic) on Feb 1, 2017 at 9:44am PST 
“It’s expertly engineered so champagne bottles are dispensed without having been shaken by delivery—which means no surprise champagne bursts upon opening,” writes Travel & Leisure . 
We’re sold. Anyone else want to figure out how to get one for our house? A quiet night in won’t ever be the same.
